revised_title: Astrophysical Applications of Neutrino, Radiation, and Energetic Particle Transport in Accretion Flows
tldr: The authors study the transport of neutrinos, radiation, and energetic particles in accretion flows onto compact objects, such as white dwarfs, neutron stars, and black holes. They find that these particles are accelerated efficiently to high energies and achieve power-law spectra. The gravitational energy of the inflowing matter is effectively transferred to high-energy particles, which can help explain non-thermal phenomena associated with accreting astronomical objects and the collapse of red giants.
